import threading
import time

# This function simulates a task that takes some time to complete
def long_running_task(id):
    print(f"Task {id} is starting.")
    time.sleep(2)  # Simulating a time-consuming task
    print(f"Task {id} is finished.")

# This function sets up and starts multiple threads for concurrency
def run_concurrent_tasks():
    threads = []
    for i in range(5):
        thread = threading.Thread(target=long_running_task, args=(i,))
        threads.append(thread)
        thread.start()
    
    # Wait for all threads to complete
    for thread in threads:
        thread.join()

# This function is supposed to execute some initialization before running tasks
def initialize_system():
    print("System initialization started.")
    # Simulate some initialization logic
    time.sleep(1)
    print("System initialization completed.")
    run_concurrent_tasks()

# Main program execution
if __name__ == "__main__":
    initialize_system()
    print("All tasks completed successfully.")
